articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 16 scientists and 10 senior commanders were among those mourned at the funeral, according to state media, including armed forces chief Major General Mohammad Bagheri and Revolutionary Guards commander General Hossein Salami.
articles.title: Iran holds funeral for top military commanders and scientists killed by Israel

articles.author: David Lawder, David Ljunggren, Susan Heavey
articles.description: The move plunges U.S.-Canada relations back into chaos after a period of relative calm.
articles.title: Trump cuts off US trade talks with Canada, shattering optimism over tariff deals

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Two people were killed and at least 14 wounded when a Russian drone smashed into a residential high-rise in Ukraine's Black Sea city of Odesa, authorities said on Saturday.
articles.title: Russian drone strike kills 2, wounds 14 in Ukraine's Odesa, authorities say

articles.author: Jan Wolfe, Will Dunham
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court on the last day of rulings for its current term gave Donald Trump his latest in a series of victories at the nation's top judicial body, one that may make it easier for him to implement contentious elements of his sweeping agenda as he tests the limits of presidential power.
articles.title: Trump victorious again as US Supreme Court wraps up its term

articles.author: Panu Wongcha-Um
articles.description: Hundreds of protesters gathered in the Thai capital Bangkok on Saturday demanding the resignation of Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra, as her government faces rising anger over a border row with Cambodia.
articles.title: Thai protesters call for Prime Minister Paetongtarn's resignation

articles.author: Jack Kim
articles.description: South Korea's former President Yoon Suk Yeol answered a summons on Saturday by a special prosecutor under a threat of another arrest as an investigation intensified over the ousted leader's failed bid to impose martial law in December.
articles.title: South Korea ex-President Yoon probed over failed martial law bid

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Heavy rain struck China's southwestern Guizhou province again on Saturday, half-submerging the already flood-stricken riverside city of Rongjiang for a second time this week and prompting the evacuation of residents to higher ground.
articles.title: Heavy rain hits China's flood-stricken Guizhou for second time in a week

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday dismissed media reports that said his administration had discussed possibly helping Iran access as much as $30 billion to build a civilian-energy-producing nuclear program.
articles.title: Trump dismisses reports US is weighing up to $30 bln civilian nuclear deal for Iran

articles.author: Sara Rossi
articles.description: The three-day gala will culminate with the closing party in a former medieval shipyard where Lady Gaga and Elton John are expected to perform.
articles.title: Newlyweds Bezos and Sanchez gear up for final party at Venice gala

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Polish President Andrzej Duda arrived in Kyiv on Saturday for a meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy, Duda's office said, as Kyiv aims to build support among allies at a critical juncture in its grinding war with Russia.
articles.title: Poland's Duda arrives in Ukrainian capital Kyiv to meet Zelenskiy
